txt.en: 'I do not mourn his passing. He thought to do much evil.'
Remain alert for any deceit or treachery. Lheu Brenin cannot be trusted.
Defeat Lheu Brenin
Talk to Gimli
Survive the assault of the Falcon Clan warriors
Talk to the child of the Westfold
Lheu Brenin and other members of the Falcon Clan have come to the Glittering Caves.
Gimli is not sure what to make of Lheu Brenin.
Learn what evil has entered the Glittering Caves
Talk to Lheu Brenin
DNT - Blah!
You have come with Gimli deeper into the Glittering Caves to make certain the folk who shelter here will be safe.

'You can do it, [placeholder]! I know that you can defeat this villain! Stand strong for Rohan, and for Théoden King!'\n\nThe girl knows nothing of Lheu Brenin's treachery in Dunland, but her belief in you, combined with the Falcon Clan's crimes, results in the restoration of your morale.
The child of the Westfold has excitedly asked for you to speak to her.
'I should never have let you leave Tâl Methedras alive. Now I will remedy that mistake!'
Lheu Brenin is ready to fight, and has no fear of you or Gimli.
Defeat Lheu Brenin

'The natural beauty of this place takes my breath away, [placeholder], but we have an important errand here and cannot stop with our mouths agape. Let us proceed and ensure that nothing lurks here to threaten the folk that shelter in the caves.'
Talk to Gimli in the Glittering Caves
Talk to the child of the Westfold

The small girl waves off your inquiry, dismissing your questions with a toss of her hair.

'There is no time to talk! My mother is with the other folk of Westfold, hiding in the cave, but I heard something back here and came to see what it was. Do you know what I found?'

She looks around quickly, and then says in a hushed whisper, 'Villains! Villains from Dunland!'
Gimli must not be defeated

'We come once more face to face, [placeholder], and once more you find yourself overmatched. Before you stand the finest of my warriors, and I the strongest of them all. None know the high mountainous paths and deep tunnels as well as the Hebog-lûth, and we have put that knowledge to good use.\n\n'I have been promised a king's reward by my ally Saruman for the death of Rohan's people, and you will not stop me. I know its women and children shelter in the caves behind you, and my force of loyal Falcons will kill any they find. You think to stop me with such allies as I see before me? A single dwarf and one child?'
Lheu Brenin has vast reserves of strength, and wishes to see you dead. You have to weaken him through battle!
DNT - Blah!
Talk to Lheu Brenin

'Who is this blustery man, [placeholder]? He is no friend of yours, and that makes him no friend of mine. I do not like his words or his tone. Let us teach him not to ally with Wizards who cannot tell the difference between evil and good!'
The child of the Westfold has tried to get your attention.
Weaken Lheu Brenin
'Good. Ready your weapons.'
'[placeholder]!'
'Did you desire so badly to die at my hands?'
Talk to Lheu Brenin
'Why else does your path so often cross with mine?'
'I do not know these others.'
'Hmmmph. Dwarves.'
Talk to the child of the Westfold
'I thought to find these caves filled with unarmed horse-folk, but your presence changes nothing.'
Lheu Brenin has come to the end of his strength, and has paid for his crimes.

'Even the children of Rohan fight against their enemies, when pressed! It fills my heart with pride to see it, for a child under the Mountain would do the same. I am impressed!\n\n'Already I engage in competition with Legolas. Need I now wager with this child, as well? Ha!'
'Kill them, my warriors! Then you will have your prize.'
'I am ashamed to call you Hebog-lûth! Fight on!'
Lheu Brenin has been defeated, and the people who shelter in the Glittering Caves are now safe from the Falcon Clan.
'No one threatens my land, my king, or my family, [placeholder]! Any villains who do had better run back to their Wizard masters!'
'Let us return to the folk who shelter in the Glittering Caves, [placeholder]. We will make sure this child reaches them safely... or perhaps she will ensure we make it safely!'
'We must be getting near to the shelter, Brenin.'
'These folk are not unarmed!'
'What are they doing here?'
'Die!'
'The talons of the Falcon will take your life!'
'For Mair!'
'Death to our enemies!'
'Death to the foes of the Falcon!'
'Who goes there?'
'I can fight!'
'Why can I not fight?'

Lheu Brenin's breath is coming now in fits and gasps, but still he remains strong and defiant.\n\n'How many of your friends have I slain, [placeholder]? I will not stop now. I will continue until none remain, and Saruman will pay me a sum worthy of a dragon's hoard for the favour!'
'I want to fight! I am almost taller than you, dwarf!'
'Over here, [placeholder]! I have something to tell you!'
'I believe in you! You can best this villain!'
'This is for all you have done, villain!'

'This man is less than a worm, [placeholder]! He is no man at all, but a thrall of Saruman's, thinking only of his reward and caring nothing for anyone: not for the people of his tribe with whom he should have a bond, nor for my people, who have done him no wrong.\n\n'I will not let him threaten my family or my king!'
Instance: Secret Ways
'I need... a moment...'
'No... wait... listen...'
Gimli is in the Glittering Caves, ready to proceed further into Aglarond.
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'You fight like boar, not falcons! These are my warriors?'
'I will do myself what my warriors could not!'
'You strike hard, but it will not be enough!'
'Now you will die!'
'You have become stronger, [placeholder].'
'I will rip you apart!'
'You... will not... win...'
'Take this!'
'It is the end for you, [placeholder]!'
Lheu Brenin, leader of the Falcon Clan, has finally paid for his crimes
'I cannot... believe this...'
Walk with Gimli deeper into the Glittering Caves
Gimli has fallen!
You have encountered a small child in the Glittering Caves.
Some villainy has come to the Glittering Caves of Aglarond.
Lheu Brenin has commanded his warriors to kill everyone in the Glittering Caves.
Weaken Lheu Brenin
Lheu Brenin has vast reserves of strength, and wishes to see you dead. You have to weaken him through battle!
Lheu Brenin has vast reserves of strength, and wishes to see you dead. You have to weaken him through battle!
'This way, [placeholder]. We must make safe this cavern.'
Talk to Gimli in the Glittering Caves
'Did you hear that? There is something ahead of us, I am sure of it!'
'This is no enemy. This is a child!'
'I am Gimli, son of Glóin, but that is no concern of yours.'
'If you creep into these caves to do harm to its folk, it is my axe you will meet instead.'
Talk to the Rohirrim child
'These strangers are fools if they think to best us, [placeholder].'
'Stay back, child! Let us handle the fighting!'
Weaken Lheu Brenin
'Even the children of this land have fight in them!'
